definition: silent contemplation/to meditate/to think in silence
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: He goes to the park every day to sit and contemplate.
sentences.chinese: 他每天去公园，坐在那里沉思默想。

sentences.english: Though they do not broodily guard their patch with bristling security.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们不用通过沉思默想重重安全来保卫领土。

sentences.english: The more you meditate on God's Word, the less you will have to worry about.
sentences.chinese: 你愈默想神的话，你的忧愁挂虑就愈少。

sentences.english: So was Isaac blessed when he walked therein at eventide to meditate.
sentences.chinese: 以撒外出到田间沉思默想，上帝就祝福他。

sentences.english: There is no right or wrong length of time to practice walking meditation.
sentences.chinese: 对于行走默想的时间没有对或错的标准。

sentences.english: Take for your meditation today these verses – Hebrews 4: 14 – 16.
sentences.chinese: 让我们今天默想希伯来书四章14至16节。

sentences.english: It is a good habit on which to ponder often.
sentences.chinese: 经常性地在心中默想幸福，这是一个好习惯。

sentences.english: She stood there in a brown study.
Turn to Hebrews 7:25 and put that verse alongside this passage also.
sentences.chinese: 请读希伯来书七章25节，并与今天的经文一同默想。

sentences.english: Those who are given to profound meditation and a quiet life without worldly desires, welcome to the lane!
sentences.chinese: 爱宁静淡泊，沉思默想的，深深的小巷在欢迎你。

sentences.english: Zhao Jianping is faced dash forward like strange misfortune coming to the ground, jing Saimo thinks.
sentences.chinese: 赵建平面对突如奇来地变故，静思默想。

definition: to study the Confucian classics/to read scriptures or canonical texts
to examine/to cast a critical eye over (especially in the context of introspection)
Book of Deuteronomy/Fifth Book of Moses
Second Epistle of Peter (in New Testament)
Epistle of St James (in New Testament)
